requirements.summary: Implement the portfolio single-page UI to exactly match the provided `Portfolio` component structure/content with anchored sections and fixed navbar.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders a fixed navbar with section links: Home, About, Skills, Projects, Resume, Contact.
Each section exists with the same headings and paragraphs as provided, and navbar links scroll to the correct section IDs.
The Contact section includes the same GitHub, LinkedIn, and email links as in the provided code (no content changes).
The Resume section contains a working download link to `/resume.pdf` (file may be added separately).

file_operations.description: Create the `Portfolio` component by transcribing the user-provided code exactly (same sections, headings, text, links, and anchor IDs like `#home`, `#about`, etc.) and keep all profile content unchanged. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Render the `Portfolio` component as the app’s primary view (SPA). Ensure any navigation/wiring needed so the fixed navbar and section anchors work as in the provided component. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add and configure frontend dependencies required by the provided UI code (Framer Motion, TypeAnimation, Lucide) so the app compiles and renders animations/icons.
acceptanceCriteria: `npm run build` (or the project’s equivalent) succeeds without TypeScript errors.
Animations (Framer Motion) and typing effect (TypeAnimation) render in the browser.
Lucide icons render for GitHub/LinkedIn/Mail in the Contact section.

file_operations.description: Add required dependencies for the provided UI code: `framer-motion`, `react-type-animation`, and `lucide-react`, keeping the existing React+TypeScript template setup intact so builds succeed.
Wire imports/usages for Framer Motion, TypeAnimation, and Lucide icons exactly as in the provided component code. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Ensure the resume PDF is served as a static asset at `/resume.pdf` and the UI download link works as coded.
acceptanceCriteria: When `resume.pdf` is present in the frontend public assets, navigating to `/resume.pdf` works in local and deployed environments.
Clicking “Download Resume” opens/downloads the PDF in a new tab as coded.

file_operations.description: Add a `resume.pdf` file under frontend public assets so it is served at `/resume.pdf` (may be a placeholder that the user replaces).

Ensure the Resume section’s download link points to `/resume.pdf` and opens/downloads in a new tab as in the provided code, without changing any surrounding text/content. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Provide reproducible Internet Computer deployment instructions using the standard dfx workflow, without requiring backend features beyond template defaults.
acceptanceCriteria: A `dfx deploy` workflow produces an accessible frontend canister URL that serves the portfolio SPA.
README includes the minimal steps/commands to run locally and deploy (e.g., install deps, start local replica, deploy).
No backend features beyond template defaults are required to view the portfolio.

file_operations.description: Document minimal local run + Internet Computer deployment steps using the project’s standard dfx workflow (install deps, start replica, build, deploy, and how to access the frontend canister URL). Keep instructions focused on deploying/viewing the portfolio SPA.
